modName: Daedric Glows - New and Enhanced Colors
summary: New colors variants for Daedric Armor Set
descriptionHtml:
[color=#00ff00][size=5]

[/size][/color][color=#00ff00][size=5][center][img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/582f/c97usy20hl278ezzg.jpg[/img][/center][/size][/color]
[size=3]
As a Daedric set lover, I always spend some time looking for new mods to "buff up" this amazing set,[/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3] but I never found something Really interesting when it's about [/size][color=#ff0000][size=4]Glows[/size][/color][size=3]. [/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3] Except one mod, pretty old, called "[font=Times New Roman][color=#ff7700][size=4]Skyrim Extended Glow - Daedric Armor[/size][/color][/font]" made by [font=Times New Roman][color=#ff7700][size=4]Alan Treeps[/size][/color][/font].
He gave me the right to use his old mod to make mine.[/size][color=#000000]


[color=#ffffff][size=3] This mod comes with, so far, 11 new colors with two variations each - Normal and Extended - and No-Glow and Vanilla versions for the Daedric set:
[/size][/color][/color][list][*][color=#980000][size=4][b]Vanilla[/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#000000][size=4][b]No-Glow[/b][/size][/color] 
[*][color=#0000ff][size=4][b]Blue[/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#B45F06][size=4][b]Brown [/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#00ffff][size=4][b]Cyan[/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#00ff00][size=4][b]Green[/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff7700][size=4][b]Orange [/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff00ff][size=4][b]Pink[/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#351C75][size=4][b]Purple[/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff0000][size=4][b]Red [/b][/size][/color]
[*][color=#ff0000][size=4][b][color=#9900ff]Soul[/color][/b][/size][/color]
[*][size=4][b]White[/b][/size]
[*][size=4][b][color=#ffff00]Yellow[/color] [/b][/size]
[/list] [b][size=4]I'm still taking color requests![/size][/b][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][b] [color=#d8d8d8][size=2]if there are any colors left haha[/size][/color][/b]
[center][b][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#674ea7][size=4][quote][color=#8e7cc3]Happy to say that right now this mod contains 24 different colors in both options (Replacer/StandAlone). Thank you all for the amazing support.[/color][/quote][/size][/color][/font][/b][/center]
[/color][/font][/i][/size]
[b][i][color=#ffff00][size=5]Special Feature:[/size] [/color][/i][/b][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]T[/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]his[/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3] m[/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]od [/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]c[/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]omes with a "full-time" glow. What does it means? It means that it will work wherever [/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]you [/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]are, [/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]under any[/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3] kind of light [/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3]or weather. Differently from the vanilla version, that when you're in certain places the glow seems to disappear, this one will keep glowing with same intensity inside the darkest cave, or under the brightest sun.[/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size][color=#000000]
[color=#999999][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][/color][color=#00ff00][size=5]                                                    [/size][/color][/color]
[color=#00ff00][size=5][img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/63cb/jmeyacm3ggx0b88zg.jpg[/img][/size][/color][color=#000000][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#666666][size=2][u]
[/u][/size][/color][/size][/color][/color][list]
[*][color=#000000][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#666666][size=2][color=#ffffff][size=3]Full Installer:[/size][/color][/size][/color][/size][/color][/color]
[/list][list=1]
[*][color=#000000][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#666666][size=2][color=#ffffff][size=3]Download[/size][/color][color=#000000][color=#ffffff][size=3] it using Nexus Mod Manager (NMM) and follow the Installer Instructions.[/size][/color][/color][/size][/color][/size][/color][/color]
[/list][color=#000000][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#666666][size=2][color=#000000][color=#ff7700][size=3][color=#ff0000] Note: Do [i][b][u]NOT[/u] [/b][/i]download the Full-Installer manually. It will be worst than bad for you to install it if not through[i][b] NMM.[/b][/i][/color][/size][/color][/color][u][color=#000000]
[/color][/u][color=#e06666][i] Note: If you don't want glowing eyes, simply go to the armor/daedric folder and delete all 4 files related to the helmets. - if you don't want glowing fingertips/claws, ask me to make one without them with the color your desire.[/i][/color][u][color=#000000]
[color=#ffffff][size=3]
[/size][/color][/color][/u][/size][/color][/size][/color][/color][list]
[*][size=3][u]For[/u] [u]Manual[/u] [u]Installation[/u] (StandAlone):[/size]
[/list][list=1]
[*][size=3]Click the "download manually" button and download the mod;[/size]
[*][size=3]Copy and paste the Data folder into your Skyrim folder (steam/steamapps/common/skyrim);[/size]
[*][size=3]Accept all changes (if asked);[/size]
[*][size=3][color=#000000][color=#ffffff]Enjoy.[/color][/color][/size]

[/list][color=#000000][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#666666][size=2][u][color=#000000]
[/color][/u][/size][/color][/size][/color][/color][list][*][u][size=3]For[/size][/u][size=3] [/size][u][size=3]Manual[/size][/u][size=3] [/size][u][size=3]Installation[/size][/u][size=3] (Replacer):[/size][/*]
[/list][list=1][*][size=3]Click the "download manually" button and download the mod;[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Copy and paste the DATA folder into your Skyrim folder (steam/steamapps/common/skyrim);[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Accept all changes (if asked);[/size][/*]
[*][size=3]Enjoy.[/size][/*]
[/list] [size=3]
Note: For the ones who want to use my files to make their own choices of colors, here's a list of what items the meshes are related to, also, for the ones who doesn't like the glowing eyes, simply delete all 4 files related to the helmets and have fun:[/size]
[color=#1e84cc][size=4][i]data/meshes/armor/daedric[/i][/size][/color]
[color=#999999][color=#ff7700][b][color=#ff0000][size=3]Male Helmet:[/size][/color][size=3][color=#999999]
[/color][/size][/b][size=3][color=#999999]daedrichelmet_0
daedrichelmet_1
[/color][/size][/color][color=#ff0000][size=3][b] M[/b][/size][/color][color=#ff0000][b][size=3]ale [/size][/b][b][size=3]Torso:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3] daedriccuirass_0
daedriccuirass_1[/size][u][b][size=3]

daedricgauntlets_1[/size][u][b][size=3]

[/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedricboots_0
daedricboots_1
[/size][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Female [/size][/b][b][size=3]Helmet:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedrichelmetf_0
daedrichelmetf_1[/size][u][b][size=3]

[/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedrictorsof_0
daedrictorsof_1 [/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Female [/size][/b][b][size=3]Gloves:[/size][/b][/color][/color]
[color=#999999][u][b][size=3] [/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedricglovesf_0
daedricglovesf_1
[/size][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Female [/size][/b][b][size=3]Boots:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedricbootsf_0
daedricbootsf_1
[/size][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Shield:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3] 1stpersondaedricshield
daedricshield
DaedricShieldOnBack
DaedricShieldOnBackClk
[/size][size=4][u][b]
[/b][/u][i] [color=#1e84cc]data/meshes/weapons/daedric[/color][/i][/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Sword:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]1stpersondaedricsword
daedricsword
DaedricSwordLeft
DaedricSwordSheath[/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Greatsword:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]1stpersondaedricgreatsword[/size][/color]
[color=#999999][size=3] daedricgreatsword[/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] War[/size][/b][b][size=3]Axe:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]1stpersondaedricwaraxe
daedricwaraxe
DaedricWaraxeLeft
DaedricWaraxeSheath[/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Battleaxe[/size][/b][/color][b][size=3][color=#ff0000]:[/color]
[/size][/b][size=3]1stpersondaedricbattleaxe
daedricbattleaxe[/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Mace:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]1stpersondaedricmace
1stPersonDaedricMaceLeft
1stPersonDaedricMaceSheath
daedricmace[/size][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Warhammer:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]1stpersondaedricwarhammer
daedricwarhammer
[/size][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Dagger:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]1stpersondaedricdagger
DaedricDagger
DaedricDaggerLeft
DaedricDaggerSheath
[/size][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Bow:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedricbowskinned[/size][/color]
[color=#999999][color=#ff0000][b][size=3] Arrows:[/size][/b][/color][u][b][size=3]
[/size][/b][/u][size=3]daedricarrow
daedricarrowprojectile[/size]

[color=#ff0000][size=4]NOTE:[/size][/color] [color=#f4f4f4][size=3]I'd also like to warn you, guys, that I've found out that Skyrim has an uknown issue/bug when altering the meshes files of a few weapons. It's not a problem with my mod, it's a problem Skyrim itself has. With this mod - Daedric Glows - you'll see that whenver you drop a Daedric Bow it will disappear completely and whenever you drop a Daedric Greatsword it will have some collision problems. So please be careful not to drop either of these items for it may cause you to lose them forever. If you're unfortunate and accidentaly drop the itens, I'll leave the [color=#ff0000][i][u]console code[/u][/i][/color] to get them back below this note. Hope you all enjoy using this mod as I enjoyed making it. Thanks for all the support.

[color=#ff0000]Daedric Bow:[/color] player.additem 139b5 1
[color=#ff0000]Dedric Greatsword:[/color] player.additem 139b7 1[/size][/color]
[color=#ff0000] [/color][/color][color=#ff0000][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u]

[/color][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#ff0000]   [/color]                                              [img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/6f15/w3fno3lib8btylbzg.jpg[/img][/size][/color]


[list][*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30612/?]Glorious Daedric Retexture[/url][/i]  -by Gloriouz[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58765/?]Glorious Daedric Dark Edition[/url][/i] -by UndeadSadness[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][list][*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34155/?]Dual Sheath Redux[/url] / [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34950/?]Immersive Animations[/url] [/i] -by Neovalen/Bergzore[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][list][*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22113/?]Daedric Crossbow[/url]  [/i]-by DJjojo[/size][/*]
[*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35717/?]Belt-Fastened Quivers[/url]  -[/i]by Chesko and Ninivekha[/size]
[/*][/list][size=4][i] ** [/i][color=#00ff00][b][size=3][u][font=Arial]Shields sheathed on back also have working glow[/font][/u][/size][/b][/color][i][size=3] **[/size][/i][/size]

[color=#00ff00][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][size=5][color=#ff0000][color=#00ff00]  [/color]    [/color]                                             
[img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/e1ab/icys4576fy7zfrfzg.jpg[/img]
[/size][/color][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#666666][size=2][u] [/u][/size][/color][/size][/color][list][*][size=3]Soon releasing v0.2 version with a dagger fix for Weapon Rack so it may also show the correct color glow unstead of the vanilla one, as happens on v0.1, also, comming with a "Dawnguard-less" version, meaning it doesn't require Dawnguard anymore to work.[/size][/*]
[*][color=#9900ff][b][i][size=3]Updated to r0.2[/size][/i][/b][/color][/*]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][list][*][size=3]Working on a Mod Installer manager for easier download, instalation and for a decent form of chosing which mod/color you want to use. Comming out on v0.3[/size][/*]
[*][color=#9900ff][i][size=3][b]Released Beta version of the Mod Installer, check it out and it's awesome features. Also comes with a fix for the red glowing shield bug.[/b][/size][/i][/color]
[/*][/list][size=3]
[/size][list][*][size=3]Working on a fix for the conflict/bug with the Helmet Toggle mod. Version comming soon with a new pack of colors.[/size][/*]
[*][color=#9900ff][size=3][b][i]Confirmed as an incompatibility that another mod has about any enhanced closed-face helmets, not a bug/conflict of my mod[/i][/b][/size][/color][/*]
[/list]
[list]
[*][size=3]Installer version 0.4 released: Contains a new and better options layout, fixed wrong directory of Daedric Crossbow files and added new images for the color options.[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][list][*][size=3]Released new StandAlone version (Armor set only, no weapons). Armor sets are craftable and temperable with the same materials as the basic Daedric Gear.[/size]
[*][size=3][color=#9900ff][b][i]Released on 31th December 2015[/i][/b][/color][/size]
[/list][size=3][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#9900ff][size=2][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][/size][/color][color=#9900ff]
 [/color]       [img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/b77e/s6552mkk6fts7twzg.jpg[/img]
[/size][/color][/size]
[color=#ff7700][size=3][color=#00ffff]Meshes details [color=#ffffff]([/color][/color][color=#ffffff]colors)[/color] [color=#00ffff]for complete[/color] [color=#ffffff]Daedric Armor Set[/color][color=#00ffff] glow effet (Male and Female versions), including [/color][color=#ffffff]All Weapons
[color=#00ffff] [/color][/color][color=#00ffff](Left and Right handed - working with[/color] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34155/?]Dual Sheath Redux[/url][color=#00ffff]) and[/color] [color=#ffffff][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22113/?]Daedric Crossbow[/url] [/color][color=#00ffff]mod.[/color][/size][/color]

[color=#ffffff][size=3]Hope you guys enjoy!
[color=#000000][size=2]
[/size][/color][b][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#00ffff][size=2][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][/size][/color][color=#00ffff]
[/color]
[img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/cf57/2x7cqfmdup2ciwmzg.jpg[/img][/size][/color][/b][color=#666666][size=2]
[/size][/color]
This mod is compatible with [color=#ff7700]Any [/color]Daedric Texture mods, such as[/size][/color]:
[list=1][*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30612/?]Glorious Daedric Retexture[/url][/i][/size][/*]
[*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3104/?]Daedric Armor and Weapons Improvement[/url][/i][/size]
[/list][size=3][i]
Also compatible with some body models and movements modifiers, such as:[/i][/size][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34155/?]
[/url][/i][/size][list=1]
[*][size=3][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34155/?]Dual Sheath Redux[/url][/i][/size]
[/list][list=1][/*]
[/list][color=#000000][size=2]
[/size][/color][b][color=#00ff00][size=5][color=#ff7700][size=2][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][/size][/color][color=#ff7700]
 [/color]                 [/size][/color][/b][size=5][i][font=Georgia][color=#ffff00][color=#ffffff][size=3][img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/51e9/4cnqcbpaq5d94q2zg.jpg[/img][/size][/color][/color][/font][/i][/size]
[size=3]
This mod isn't supposed to conflict with any other mod, except for mods made to change arrows.
Mods like[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37358/?] Ultimate Spinning Arrows[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29086/?]Archery - Spinning Arrows[/url] will "conflict" with my mod, causing the arrows to
don't have glows.

[color=#ff00ff] How do I fix it?[/color]
Simple: Choose. You want glowing arrows or spinning arrows? Pick one and have fun.


 This mod also does Not support any mods that changes completely the form of the weapons or armor, such as [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39870/?][size=3]Better Shaped Weapons[/size][/url][color=#000000][size=2] [color=#f4f4f4][size=3]or similar.   [/size][/color][/size][/color][color=#000000][size=2][color=#f4f4f4][size=3]
[/size][/color]
[/size][/color][b][color=#ffff00][size=5][color=#ff00ff][size=2][u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][/size][/color][color=#ff00ff]
[/color]
[img]http://www.mediafire.com/convkey/9322/gt8dsavedgt1n43zg.jpg[/img][/size][/color][/b][color=#666666][size=2]
[/size][/color]

[color=#ff7700][size=3][color=#ff0000]Thanks for the help of a continuous [b]interjection[/b] of an [b]unsolicited[/b] opinion:[/color] [i][color=#ffffff]SalZone[/color][/i][/size][/color]

[color=#38761D][size=3][color=#ff0000]Special thanks to[/color] [color=#ffffff][i][b]Eckss[/b][/i][/color][color=#ff0000], for helping me with my Mod Installer. Best teacher anyone could ever have. [/color][i][color=#ffffff]I more than owe you.[/color][/i]
[color=#ff0000] I also thank[/color] [color=#ffffff]Chaosandsorrow[/color][color=#ff0000] and[/color][color=#00ff00] [color=#ffffff]99Cent[/color][/color] [color=#ff0000]for helping me try out the installer and a bunch of other things.[/color] [color=#ffffff]I'd be lost without you two.[/color][/size][/color]
[color=#ff0000][size=2]

[u]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    [/u][/size][/color]
author: Zaronios

files.name: Full Installer - 0.6
files.changelogHtml:
New Extended Orange and Normal Yellow color options.
Changed the glow intensity of Normal Red/White/Orange versions.
Added glowing Daedric Bolt Quiver.
Fixed body position of Daedric Bolt Quiver.
Added new Brown color - Normal and Extended Versions.

files.name: StandAlone Armor - Normal Purple
files.changelogHtml:
Added new StandAlone (Armors only, no weapons) download options.
StandAlone armors are fully craftable and temperable.
StandAlone crafting and tempering materals are same as basic Daedric gear.
